titleStmt.title: Seuen sobs of a sorrowfull soule for sinne comprehending those seuen Psalmes of the princelie prophet David, commonlie called Pœnitential / framed into a forme of familiar praiers, and reduced into meeter by William Hunnis ... ; wherevnto are also annexed his Handfull of honisuckles, The poore widowes mite, a dialog betweene Christ and a sinner, diuers godlie and pithie ditties, with a Christian confession of and to the Trinitie.
titleStmt.author: Hunnis, William, d. 1597.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Henrie Denham, dwelling in Pater noster Rowe, at the signe of the Starre,

notesStmt.note: "A handfull of honisuckles", "The poore widowes mite", and "Comfortable dialogs betweene Christ and a sinner" each has special t.p.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
